image.altText: Two men in suits speaking at a press conference outside.

props.synopsis: The AFL might need to start paying attention to the political problem it's created in Tasmania with the deal it has made for a Hobart stadium.

title.children: The power of the AFL versus Australia's smallest state. It was never an even contest

image.altText: Beau Webster gives the thumbs up after receiving his Baggy Green before his first Test.

props.synopsis: Beau Webster's path to the top has been a long and winding one, but his tiny hometown of Snug has been behind him all the way and his former coaches always knew there was something special about the way he plays the game.

title.children: From a tiny Tasmanian town to the SCG: Inside Beau Webster's rise

image.altText: Spirit of Tasmania IV ship in port.

props.synopsis: The Spirit of Tasmania IV has entered a second month mothballed in Scotland while efforts to rent the ship out continue â€” with Tasmania's government saying the weekly $23,915 bill, plus costs, is cheaper than last month's storage fee.

title.children: Scottish mothballing of Tasmanian ferry continues

image.altText: A Congolese mother, father and their two daughters sit in their loungeroom cheerfully posing

props.synopsis: Baruani Nundu and his family arrived in Australia five months ago, after years living in a refugee camp in Kenya. A group of local volunteers is filling the role of extended family and helping them get adjusted.

title.children: Nundu family settles in rural Tasmania with help of refugee 'buddy system'

image.altText: Concept art showing interior of sports stadium with cricket match underway.

props.synopsis: Economist Nicholas Gruen says the new stadium, a condition of Tasmania's entry into the AFL, can't be built on time and on budget. He says it's in the interests of the both the state government and the AFL to acknowledge the project's constraints.

title.children: AFL urged to show 'leniency' on Tasmania as stadium concerns grow

image.altText: Red circles highlighting two hikers clinging to a steep rockface on a mountain.

props.synopsis: Police say two interstate bushwalkers attempting to navigate the Hazards mountain range on Tasmania's east coast have been rescued from a "precarious position".

title.children: 'Zoom in' and see how in danger these tourists were, police say

image.altText: Sporting stadium exterior concept art.

props.synopsis: A leading independent economist tasked with reviewing Tasmania's proposal to build an AFL stadium on Hobart's waterfront finds the project is "already displaying the hallmarks of mismanagement" and is likely to exceed $1 billion.

title.children: Did you miss? ðŸ“£ Review finds Hobart stadium costs to 'exceed $1 billion'

image.altText: A concept image of the proposed Hobart stadium at Macquarie Poi nt.

props.synopsis: A leading independent economist tasked with reviewing Tasmania's proposal to build an AFL stadium on Hobart's waterfront finds the project is "already displaying the hallmarks of mismanagement" and is likely to exceed $1 billion.

title.children: Review finds Hobart stadium costs to 'exceed $1 billion'

image.altText: Peter Dombrovskis' iconic photograph of the Mount Anne wilderness, Tasmania.

props.synopsis: Photography equipment used by Peter Dombrovskis, who brought images of Tasmania's beauty to the world, has been stolen as police say they're investigating a "series of significant burglaries" in Hobart's southern suburbs.

title.children: Camera equipment that belonged to renowned wilderness photographer stolen

image.altText: A woman and paramedics in a living room, with faces blurred.

props.synopsis: A woman with complex health care needs has been trying to get out of an aged care home since being put there by the state.

title.children: 'I want my rights back': Woman takes public guardianship ruling to court

image.altText: A large explosion beside a Gaza highway throwing debris into the air, caused by an airstrike.

props.synopsis: Israel's military says it has struck approximately 40 Hamas targets in Gaza in the space of the day.

title.children: Rockets fired at Israel as 16 killed in Gaza strikes

image.altText: Donald trump in a suit with his fist in the air.

props.synopsis: The president-elect will be sentenced on January 10, just 10 days before his inauguration.

title.children: Judge rules Trump must be sentenced in 'hush money' trial 10 days prior to inauguration

image.altText: A man in graduation outfit.

props.synopsis: The past year has seen the international education sector thrown into turmoil, as Labor targeted students in their plan to drive down migration. That uncertainty is set to continue into 2025.Â

title.children: International student numbers hit record highs last year but a seismic shift is underway

image.altText: Heidi wearing a backpack and smiling in the gardens of the Abbotsford Convent.

props.synopsis: An antipsychotic medication often prescribed to people with schizophrenia or bipolar is in short supply.

title.children: Shortage of antipsychotic medication leaves mental health patients in limbo

image.altText: Reilly Opelka hugs Novak Djokovic

props.synopsis: As Novak Djokovic ascended to the pinnacle of tennis history, Reilly Opelka was watching from the sidelines, using Djokovic's success to plot his own return from injury, culminating in a stunning boilover victory at the Brisbane International.

title.children: Reilly Opelka's stunning win over Djokovic a moment years in the making

image.altText: An grizzled old white man in a band t shirt and fedora sings onstage playing guitar

props.synopsis: The Canadian singer of Heart of Gold and Harvest Moon says he will now appear at the UK festival after earlier criticising the festival's partnership with the BBC.

title.children: Neil Young reverses Glastonbury cancellation over BBC 'corporate control'

image.altText: A race track damaged

props.synopsis: Detectives are investigating a damaged race track which has forced the relocation of the start of the highly anticipated Gold Coast Magic Millions racing carnival.

title.children: Track damage forces Magic Millions race move to Sunshine Coast

image.altText: A Polish tennis player roars with her fists pumped after winning a key point in a match.

image.altText: A women in black bikini applying tanning lotion

props.synopsis: The halter neck bikini tan line appears to have become the ultimate summer accessory, prompting concern from sun safety experts.

image.altText: pedestrians walk past the reserve bank of australia building

props.synopsis: The Australian dollar has come under a lot of pressure over the past two weeks, raising the question is the Reserve Bank close to stepping into the currency market to support the Australian dollar?

title.children: Risks are rising for Reserve Bank intervention on the Australian dollar

image.altText: A young male basketball player takes the ball to the hoop.

props.synopsis: It looks just like a normal basketball game in suburban Australia, but for these young players, there's so much more at stake.

title.children: Basketball is more than a game for these kids. It's their pass to a better life

image.altText: A white cruise ship on turquoise waters off an island with palm trees.

props.synopsis: The Pacific's tourism bodies say cruising looks different since the industry's post-pandemic comeback â€” and outer islands could be among the winners.

title.children: Far from Europe's overcrowded cruise hotpots, the Pacific is grappling with a different question

image.altText: A four-wheel-drive towing a caravan along a bitumen road, captured by drone, surrounded by red dirt and small green shrubs.

props.synopsis: The $10 million funding comes amid a drop in the number of caravanning trips in recent years as the number of grey nomads heading on overseas holidays increases.

title.children: Drive-in movies, croc pool upgrades to lure tourists back to caravan parks

image.altText: Cameron Bancroft collides with Daniel Sams

props.synopsis: Cameron Bancroft's summer appears to be over after a nightmare clash with Daniel Sams as the pair ran full pace at each other while running for a catch in the BBL.

title.children: Bancroft left with broken shoulder and nose after brutal BBL clash with teammate

image.altText: cattle walk across the plains at Kellerberrin Shire WA as the sun sets

props.synopsis: Temperatures across south-east states are predicted to soar up to 12C above the January average, while the staple summer monsoon is nowhere to be seen in the tropics.

title.children: Heatwave for Australia's south-east, monsoon absent for tropics

image.altText: Luke Littler pumps both of his firsts in celebration

props.synopsis: The English prodigy has etched his name into the record books by defeating three-time winner Michael van Gerwen.

title.children: Luke Littler becomes youngest-ever darts world champion at 17

image.altText: Woman uses a pastry brush on the pastry of a summer fruit galette, filled with stone fruit and berries.

props.synopsis: Showcase summer fruit in this rustic tart that's beautiful and delicious. Using season fruit means the filling needs minimal prep.

image.altText: crazy frog header

image.altText: A pregnant woman in a pink shirt looks at the camera, cows are in the background.

props.synopsis: Every fortnight, Peta Mackay has driven herself from her home in outback Corner Country to medical appointments in Adelaide. Finally, her due date is in sight.Â

image.altText: The silhoette of a man looms in front of an orange sports car, cash and a watch.

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation has examined more than a dozen lawsuits revealing big gaps between the expectation and reality of confiscation laws, which regulators say are designed to "undermine the profitability of serious and organised crime".

title.children: Crime confiscation laws are missing the 'Mr Bigs'

image.altText: A bronzey brown pod-looking object held up against leaves
